caption: Small foundation with absolute masterpieces of Giacometti, including his partly reconstructed studio. The building has nothing to do with Giacometti, but it‚Äôs a very interesting building that has belonged to another artist. Sculptures are beautifully displayed and daylight adds to the atmosphere.

A recreation of Giacometti's studio is the star attraction of this museum. Housed in a beautiful art nouveau building that also exhibits contemporary works in response to Giacometti. Worth a visit if you're an art lover.

We had an amazing tour of the painted sculptures exhibition with Zoe, she was brilliant, you could clearly see her passion and knowledge of Giacometti. The works were also well curated and displayed in a really lovely setting. Highly recommend visiting and getting the guided tour option as well.
Small but beautiful museum

Small and not so interesting unless you are really a big fan of Giacometti. Probably the most interesting things are some original paints by Dali.  This museum is really small and when I visited it it was overcrowded. Hard to enjoy.

Small but well curated space of the work of Giacometti. When we visited, there was an interesting exhibition of the work by Douglas Gordon (24 hour psycho video artist) who made work combining his own with Giacometti‚Äôs smaller sculptures, which worked well playing with scale and proportion.
This is a little jewel of a place. The architecture & the art. If you like Giacometti or modern art in general of course it‚Äôs a must
Nice but‚Ä¶ not worth the price you pay or getting there specially.
Very nice studio, I appreciated the synergy between sculpture and painting created by the artist
Nice little museum. Not a lot to see, very short visit
The skinny legends made me self conscious so I skipped the cr√®me br√ªl√©e for dinner üëçüèΩ ‚Ä¶
Not a lot to view but the lecture given about his life was presented expertly.
Small but beautiful place. Art deco house full of giacometti artworks.
It's really small and expensive. It's pretty, and there are a couple of nice pieces to see, but that's it. Some private houses have bigger collections.

A very well-curated collection of Giacometti‚Äôs works and the recreation of his studio, housed in a small but beautiful art d√©co apartment. The guides can tell you a lot about the works in display so it‚Äôs really worth going on a guided tour.
tiny museum, the architecture is delicious, the staff was kind. I love the in situ recreation of giacometti's studio in the first room. perfect to explore alone with some classical music.

This is the former house of the swiss artist Alberto Giacometti that used it for a while when he lived in Paris. It is a small overview of his life as an artist, with rooms exposing drawings and photos and of course the beautiful long figures he created. The design of this museum is very modern and Giacometti's work is well presented. You can also enjoy a moment in a small cinema room and a beautiful library where you can find many books about different artists. Very poetic exhibition in general, with quotes on the wall and nice arrangements of Giacometti's figures and pictures, to perfectly represent the soul of the artist and the general ideas of his work.

I was amazed to see the foundation for Giacometti‚Äôs sculptures is heavy duty wire. Once I knew that I finally understood him. Fascinating little place where one can see changing exhibits of his work.
an intimate view into giacomettis work - small but worth a visit if you are a great fan ..

Complete waste of time. How they can charge 15E for this I have no idea. Very small place with only a few Giacometti‚Äôs paired with a modern similar artist‚Äôs who was terrible. We were in and out in about 15mins.

We lived the guided tour. The tour guide was lovely and really helped sell the museum. The museum itself is tiny but it is in a beautiful building and they do bring in other artists related to Giacometti to fill the space. The highlight is the bedroom of Giacometti!!
Very instructive if you're on a guided tour.  Unless you are familiar with arts

I love to go and visit how Egypt inspired the work of Giacometti. Travelling under Covid rules is a bit rigid and unpractical but maybe I still get the chance. I ordered the catalogue. The theme for this exhibition looks great.
Nice art gallery
Special tightly focused thoughtful art display.
I'm a big fan of Giacometti. That's why it was really disappointed. Their collection was really poor.
Interesting and insightful!
I was dissapointed. I expected more Giacometti  sculptures. It was very interesting though to see his modest small studio.
The Institute is the house of the late sculptor. There are a few works and the house itself is beautiful. Plan for about 20-30 minutes inside, because there are actually 3 rooms to visit.
Very manageable small museum a bit off the tourist path
Very nice building, and the reconstruction of Giacometti's studio with the original peaces of walls is great! Quite small museum, so short visit.
Very disappointing for general public. Small. Packed. Expensive. Extremely few works mostly book photographs.
Interesting BUT it‚Äôs very compact
The Fondation Giacometti is housed in the former mansion of the French decorator and designer Paul Follot. It was built between 1912 and 1914.
Little gem hidden in a quiet street. A good story of Giacomettis work. And helpful staff to explain.
Time stands still.  You have enough time here to concentrate on a few pieces.  Great place
In love with this place!
Small but interesting museum in lovely art-deco-apartment.
